admin_state_up.description: The administrative state of the resource, which is up (true) or down (false).

device_id.description: The ID of the device that uses this port. For example, a server instance or a logical router.

device_owner.description: The entity type that uses this port. For example, compute:nova (server instance).

items.title: fixed_ips
items.description: The IP addresses for the port. If the port has multiple IP addresses, this field has multiple entries.

ip_address.description: The IP address of the port.

items.title: allowed_address_pairs
items.description: A set of zero or more allowed address pair objects each where address pair object contains an ip_address and mac_address.

ip_address.description: The IP address of the port.

mac_address.description: The MAC address of the port.
The MAC address of the port.

network_id.description: The ID of the attached network.

status.description: The port status. Values are ACTIVE, DOWN, BUILD and ERROR.

items.description: The IDs of security groups applied to the port.

items.title: extra_dhcp_opts
items.description: A set of zero or more extra DHCP option pairs. An option pair consists of an option value and name.

port_security_enabled.description: The port security status. A valid value is enabled (true) or disabled (false).

binding:host_id.description: The ID of the host where the port resides.

binding:vif_type.description: The type of which mechanism is used for the port.

additionalProperties.description: A dictionary which contains additional information on the port.

binding:vnic_type.description: The type of vNIC which this port should be attached to. This is used to determine which mechanism driver(s) to be used to bind the port.

additionalProperties.description: A dictionary that enables the application running on the specific host to pass and receive vif port information specific to the networking back-end.
